metadata.title: CVE-2022-22576 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An improper authentication vulnerability exists in curl 7.33.0 to and including 7.82.0 which might allow reuse OAUTH2-authenticated connections without properly making sure that the connection was authenticated with the same credentials as set for this transfer. This affects SASL-enabled protocols: SMPTP(S), IMAP(S), POP3(S) and LDAP(S) (openldap only).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-22576` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1
libcurl3-nss - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1
libcurl4 - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1').
